Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.(a) Air pollutants are a concern because they can lead to a variety of negative environmental and human health consequences. One group of such pollutants is nitrogen oxides.i. Identify one way nitrogen oxides <math alttext="N O x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>x</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> are commonly introduced into the atmosphere.
ii. Explain how nitrogen oxides released into the atmosphere can lead to the formation of a secondary pollutant that can lead to acid deposition.
iii. Describe one method for reducing nitrogen oxide emissions into the atmosphere from anthropogenic sources.

(b) Nitrogen dioxide is a nitrogen oxide that can lead to the formation of ozone <math alttext="O 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and photochemical smog in the troposphere. The three figures below show three scenarios involving <math alttext="O 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> formation and destruction in the troposphere. Figure 1 Figure 2 Figure 3 i. Describe how the sun affects the processes illustrated in Figure 1.
ii. Describe how the sun affects the process illustrated in Figure 2.

iii. Explain how the presence of volatile organic compounds <math alttext="V O C s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(VOCs)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in Figure 3 prevents the process seen in Figure 2.

c) A student performed an experiment to determine the effect of acid rain on plant growth. The student divided 80 seeds of a fast-growing plant species into four groups of 20 seeds each. The four groups of seeds were then planted in soil. After all of the seeds germinated in the same growing conditions, they were watered once a day with simulated rainwater that had different levels of acidity. The acidity of the four different watering solutions was as follows: neutral water, 0.1%, 1.0%, and 10%. The average height of the plants in each group was measured over a two-week period.i. Identify the independent variable in the experiment.
ii. Describe the control in the experiment.
iii. Based on the described experiment, state a valid hypothesis for the experiment.
iv. The experiment was repeated and each soil had the addition of crushed limestone. Describe how the modification of the study would affect the results.
